pasta.service

Class UnitTestManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • pasta.service.UnitTestManager

  • @Service(value="unitTestManager")
@Repository
public class UnitTestManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Unit Test manager.

    Manages interaction between controller and data. This class works as an abstraction layer between the controller and the underlying data models. This class contains the majority of the logic code dealing with objects and their interactions.

    Since:
    2014-01-31
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Alex Radu

      • addUnitTest

        public void addUnitTest(NewUnitTest newTest)
        Add a new unit test

        Assume the unit test name is unique. This must be enforced in another class for now (thought this should probably be moved here at a later date). The unit test properties xml will be created in the correct folder and any zip file that was uploaded will be unpacked using PASTAUtil.extractFolder(String).

        Parameters:
        newTest - the new unit test form used to create a new unit test template

      • removeUnitTest

        public void removeUnitTest(java.lang.String testName)
        Helper method
        Parameters:
        testName - the short name (no whitespace) of the unit test template to be removed
        See Also:
        AssessmentDAO.removeUnitTest(String)

      • testUnitTest

        public void testUnitTest(Submission submission,
                java.lang.String testName)
        Method to test the unit tests uploaded

        This method is used to test whether the unit tests are working as anticipated on the system before assigning it as a part of an assessment and releasing it to students. There is no queue system implemented for this now. As soon as the method is called, the testing proceeds. Use at your own risk.

        1. Create a new folder $ProjectLocation$/template/unitTest/$unitTestName$/test, if folder already exists, delete it and make a new one
        2. Copy and extract submission code to that folder using PASTAUtil.extractFolder(String)
        3. Copy the unit test code from $ProjectLocation$/template/unitTest/$unitTestName$/code
        4. run the ant targets "build", "test", "clean"
        5. any errors will be written to "compile.errors" and "run.errors" and the results are written to results.xml
        Parameters:
        submission - the submission form (containing the zip)
        testName - the short name (no whitespace) of the test

      • updateUnitTestCode

        Parameters:
